Herobanner.Html:
Find a course

Find a course to help you improve your current digital skills or study for your future.

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
The Skills Toolkit

Free courses to help you learn new skills or change jobs. Including general skills that apply to all sectors and more specialised skills.

Learn about:

  • practical maths
  • computer essentials
  • personal growth and wellbeing
  • professional development
  • business and finance
  • digital design and marketing
  • computer science
  • coding

Our trusted course providers include The Open University, Google, Amazon and FutureLearn.

Explore free online courses

Search other courses

Search for courses from learning providers, including colleges and local authority providers which may offer work-related courses on a wide range of topics.

Explore other courses

The Skills Toolkit: legal disclaimer and copyright statement

Overview

The Skills Toolkit is made up of a wide range of digital and numeracy courses available online, offered by a variety of providers. To help you navigate the offer, the Department for Education has selected a small number of courses and online resources from reputable providers. 

We have consulted some of the country’s leading educational experts and employers to select these courses and they offer a wide range of opportunities to all skill levels. They are currently being offered for free. This list of resources is not exhaustive and there are many other resources available. We will keep this under review and may update the list from time to time.

Copyright statement

All Intellectual Property Rights and Copyright in the free material provided by course providers, belongs to the relevant course provider. The below User Terms explain:

  • when and how you can use copyright material (including material that is Crown copyright) including downloading it onto your device
  • when and how you must acknowledge the course provider or the original copyright owner
  • when and where you should include a reference to the Open Government Licence or any specific copyright statement

User terms: Accessing and using The Skills Toolkit

The Skills Toolkit contains a list of online educational resources which has been compiled and is managed by the Department for Education (referred to as “we” or “us”). Users are referred to as “you” whether in their individual capacity or as agents or representatives of an organisation they work for. Access to The Skills Toolkit list through this Website is subject to:

  • the terms and conditions of use of the course providers set out on their websites, including any relevant disclaimers
  • the below The Skills Toolkit Disclaimer
  • GOV.UK’s terms and conditions

By accessing The Skills Toolkit, you agree to the terms and conditions of use of The Skills Toolkit, when you view or upload the homepage of The Skills Toolkit through the homepage of the main DfE website published on GOV.UK. When you enrol on any of the online courses, you will be bound by the terms and conditions of use of the relevant course provider.

The Skills Toolkit disclaimer

Although we make every reasonable effort to select appropriate courses, we do not have any control over them and, in particular, we are not responsible for:

  • the protection of any information you give to course providers
  • your failure to comply with relevant copyright or other intellectual property right law
  • any loss or damage that may come from any use or misuse of course provider websites, or any other websites they link to (together 'Third Party Websites')

You must not assume that the list of courses on The Skills Toolkit is exhaustive, or that sources or resources that have been omitted are of no value or inappropriate as online educational resources.

You should read all terms and conditions, privacy policies and end user licences that relate to the online courses before you enrol as you will be bound by their terms when you enrol.

You are responsible for choosing which online course for which you want to enrol and we will not have any responsibility if your selected online course does not meet your requirements or provide the learning you require.

You agree to release us from any claims or disputes that may arise from your use of Third Party Websites.

The Skills Toolkit

Free courses to help you learn new skills or change jobs. Including general skills that apply to all sectors and more specialised skills.

2 courses to help with fractions, decimals and other maths skills for work and everyday life
  • The Open University

    Everyday Maths

    Maths skills to help with work and everyday life.

    This course covers:
    • fractions
    • decimals
    • percentages
    • how to read diagrams and charts
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 48 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Office administration, bookkeeper, payroll administrator
  • The Open University

    Numbers, units and arithmetic

    Learn the basics of working with positive and negative numbers and how to multiply and divide with fractions and decimals.

    Find out about:
    • whole numbers and decimals
    • multiplication and division
    • fractions
    • the best units for a task
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 5 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs

6 courses to help you use a computer, the internet and office programs like spreadsheets and word processors.
  • Good Things Foundation

    Learn My Way

    Collection of resources to help you use the internet.

    Learn things like:
    • how to use your computer or device
    • find a job online
    • use public service
    • use office programs like Microsoft Word or Excel
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: Under 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Good Things Foundation

    Make It Click

    Over 150 resources to help with digital skills.

    Find out about things like:
    • sending emails
    • creating a CV
    • editing photos
    • advice for working from home
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: Under 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Microsoft

    Get the best out of Microsoft Outlook

    Learn how to use Microsoft Outlook, an email program used in the workplace.

    Find out how to do things like:
    • send an email
    • book a meeting
    • manage your calendar
    • organise a to-do list
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: Under 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Office administrator and other office roles
  • Lloyds Bank

    Learn For Everyday Life

    Over 30 resources to help with digital skills, organisation and finance.

    Find out about things like how to:
    • stay safe online
    • use office programs, like Microsoft Word
    • work with digital devices
    • improve your CV
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: Under 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Accenture and FutureLearn

    Digital Skills: Digital Skills for Work and Life

    Find out how digital is changing our personal and professional lives. Develop the skills to succeed in a digital world.

    You will learn:
    • the meaning of ‘digital’
    • how digital is changing the ways we work and live
    • its impact on jobs and industries
    • the opportunities and challenges of digital
    • how to adopt a ‘growth mindset’
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 2 hours
    Study type: Scheduled, no instructor
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • The Open University

    Digital skills: succeeding in a digital world

    Find out how to use digital technology safely and critically.

    Learn how to:
    • be confident about your online identity
    • choose and use the best online tool for a task
    • use technology confidently and critically
    • identify digital skills to develop further
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 24 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs

7 courses to help with decision making, your mindset and dealing with stress and resilience.
  • FutureLearn, Institute of Coding and University of Leeds

    Wellbeing and Resilience at Work

    The modern workplace is demanding and rapidly changing. Find out how to navigate it.

    Learn how to:
    • be resilient and adaptable
    • evaluate your strengths at work
    • identify the value of workplace wellbeing
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Virtual college

    Growth Mindset

    A growth mindset is a concept from psychology. It is the belief that you can improve your intelligence and character through learning.

    You will learn:
    • what a growth mindset is
    • how to encourage a growth mindset
    • the benefits of feedback
    • about ‘the learning zone’ and ‘the performance zone’
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 30 minutes
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Virtual college

    Personal and Professional Development: Resilience

    Learn how to adapt and be flexible in the face of challenging circumstances, whilst maintaining a stable mental outlook.

    This course covers:
    • what resilience is
    • why resilience is important
    • how to improve your own resilience
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 25 minutes
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Virtual college

    Personal Development and Self-Awareness

    Discover self-awareness and how it can help you develop.

    You will learn:
    • what self-awareness is and why it is important
    • how to set SMART objectives
    • action planning
    • how to apply self-awareness
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 45 minutes
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Virtual college

    Dealing with Stressful Situations

    Find out how to deal with stressful situations at work and in life.

    You will learn:
    • what stress is
    • what triggers and responses are
    • how people cope with stress
    • tools and techniques for managing stress
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 30 minutes
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • Virtual college

    Neuroscience for Personal Development

    Neuroscience plays an important role in how we learn. Insights from neuroscience can help you develop learning, memory and personal development skills.

    Find out about:
    • neural networks and neuroplasticity
    • attention, memory and neurogenesis
    • what holistic learning is
    • the limits of learning
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 20 minutes
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • The Open University

    Developing career resilience

    Find out how to take control of your career and deal with the challenges it can bring.

    Learn how to:
    • identify strengths of resilient people
    • recognise the strengths you already have
    • understand changing trends in the job market
    • identify tactics for goal setting
    • overcome setbacks
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 24 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs

    Find out how to present yourself to employers and enhance your profile at work.

    Find out what makes a good leader and how to improve your leadership skills.

    Exploring career mentoring and coaching

    You will learn:

    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • The Open University

    Effective communication in the workplace

    Learn about the importance of communication in the workplace and how to improve your communication skills.

    Find out about:

    Total study time: 24 hours

    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs
  • The Open University

    Total study time: 24 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs

9 courses including project and business management, bookkeeping and sales.

    Cost: Free

10 courses including user experience design (UX), graphic design, app design and social media.

    Introduction to Virtual, Augmented and Mixed Reality

  • FutureLearn, Institute of Coding and Creative Computing Institute

    Introduction to Conversational Interfaces

    Explore conversational interfaces, like chatbots and virtual assistants.

    You will learn:
    • what conversational and voice-based interfaces are
    • how to design and develop one
    • the ethics of conversational and voice-based interfaces
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: User experience (UX) designer, app developer, web developer
  • FutureLearn, Institute of Coding and Lancaster University

    Introduction to Physical Computing

    Explore microcontrollers, the technology used in smartphones, smartwatches and smart kettles.

    You will learn:
    • what physical computing is
    • the structure of a physical computing system
    • the ethics of physical computing
    • careers in physical computing
    • what the Internet of Things (IoT) is
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Product designer, software developer
  • Amazon Web Services

    AWS Cloud Practitioner Essentials

    The Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud is a popular cloud computing platform, used by many large tech companies. Find out how AWS Cloud works.

    You will learn:
    • what cloud computing is
    • how AWS works
    • how to interact with AWS
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 6 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: IT service engineer, project manager
  • Amazon Web Services

    Data Analytics Fundamentals

    Find out how to plan for data analysis using Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the processes you need to follow. To get the most out of this course, you will need some understanding of databases and enterprise IT systems.

    You will learn:
    • about different data analysis solutions and when to apply them
    • how to define different types of data
    • how data is stored
    • different techniques used in data analysis
    • the difference between data and information
    • how to use data to produce reports
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 3.5 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Data analyst-statistician, data scientist, technical architect
  • Amazon Web Services

    AWS Security Fundamentals

    Learn about cloud computing and Amazon Web Service (AWS) security concepts.

    Find out about:
    • security benefits of AWS cloud computing
    • how to secure sensitive information
    • network security
    • risk management strategies
    • auditing AWS security infrastructure
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: IT security co-ordinator, IT support technician
  • Microsoft and LinkedIn

    Become an IT Administrator

    Collection of resources covering different skills needed for information technology (IT) administration and networking.

    Find out about:
    • computer networks
    • internet protocols
    • wireless, cloud and mobile networking
    • Microsoft technologies, like Azure Administrator and 365 Administrator
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 43 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Network engineer, network manager
  • LinkedIn and Microsoft

    Become an IT Support Specialist

    Collection of resources covering different skills needed to work in information technology (IT) support, or on an IT helpdesk. This prepares you for the industry recognised CompTIA A+ certification.

    Find out about:
    • computer hardware
    • CPUs and RAM
    • computer storage
    • monitors, graphics cards and projectors
    • computer networks
    • the internet and cloud computing
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 35 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: IT support technician
  • LinkedIn and Microsoft

    Become a Data Analyst

    Collection of resources covering different skills in data analysis.

    Find out about:
    • terms used to describe data
    • statistics
    • data visualisation
    • tools, including Microsoft Excel and Power BI
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 30 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Data analyst-statistician, market research data analyst
  • Microsoft

    Azure Fundamentals

    Find out about Azure, a popular cloud computing service.

    You will learn:
    • concepts from cloud computing
    • the benefits of cloud computing in Azure
    • strategies for transitioning to Azure
    • about services available in Azure
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: 10 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Software developer
  • Microsoft

    Accessibility Fundamentals

    Learn how to make accessible content and use accessibility features in popular Microsoft products.

    You will learn:
    • what accessibility is
    • about accessibility features in Microsoft products
    • how to make accessible content for the web and mobile apps
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: 3 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: App developer, software developer, user experience (UX) designer
  • FutureLearn

    Introduction to indie games

    Find out about the thriving independent games sector and how to launch a career in it.

    You will learn:
    • about the culture of indie games
    • why indie games matter
    • how to pitch a game idea
    • roles and skills in indie games
    • where the industry is heading
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Computer games developer, product designer
  • The Open University

    Digital thinking tools for better decision-making

    Find out how digital thinking tools, like Google Search, help us solve problems and make decisions. Then apply those tools to practical issues.

    Learn how to:
    • use digital thinking tools
    • describe how digital tools help us
    • discuss the future of digital tools and artificial intelligence
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 24 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most jobs

10 courses including HTML, CSS, Python, C, C++.
  • The Open University

    Learn to Code for Data Analysis

    Learn programming to analyse and visualise open data. Visualising data helps show patterns and trends. You will learn to code in Python during this course. You do not need any prior coding knowledge.

    Find out how to:
    • access open data
    • clean and analyse data using code
    • produce visualisations
    • present your analyses
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 24 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Data analyst-statistician, market research data analyst
  • Cisco Networking Academy

    Programming Essentials in Python

    Learn to code in Python: a programming language used by small companies and tech giants.

    Find out how to:
    • write your own computer programs
    • design a web or desktop app
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: 70 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: App developer, software developer, computer games developer
  • Google Digital Garage

    Understand the Basics of Code

    Learn what code is and why understanding it is useful.

    Find out:
    • how code works
    • why so many coding languages exist
    • which coding languages are suited to specific tasks
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: 1 hour
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Useful for most technology jobs
  • FutureLearn, Institute of Coding and University of Leeds

    Computer Programming for Everyone

    Explore what computer programming and code can do.

    You will learn:
    • how and why people program computers
    • the kinds of problems that computers can help you solve
    • an introductory block-language for coding
    • about different types of coding languages
    • useful applications of code
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: App developer, software developer
  • FutureLearn, Institute of Coding and University of Leeds

    Learn to Code for the Web

    Find out about the different coding languages used to make websites. Then try using them yourself.

    Learn about these coding languages:
    • HTML
    • CSS
    • Javascript
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Web developer
  • Cisco Networking Academy

    Programming Essentials in C

    Learn to code in C: a popular programming language commonly used in software development. You don't need any previous programming experience or knowledge to do this course.

    You will learn:
    • concepts of computer programming
    • syntax, semantics and data types of C
    • how to write your own computer programs
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 70 hours
    Study type: Scheduled, instructor-led
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Software developer
  • Cisco Networking Academy

    Programming Essentials in C++

    Learn to code in C++: a popular programming language commonly used in video games development. You don't need any previous programming experience or knowledge to do this course.

    You will learn:
    • syntax, semantics and data types of C++
    • principles of object-oriented programming
    • how to write in C++
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 70 hours
    Study type: Scheduled, instructor-led
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Video games developer, software developer
  • Microsoft and LinkedIn

    Become a Software Developer

    Collection of resources covering different skills in software development.

    This course covers:
    • databases
    • HTML and CSS
    • Javascript, Python and C#
    • Microsoft technologies, like Azure and 365 developer
    Certificate of completion: Yes
    Total study time: 40 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Software developer, web developer, app developer
  • Microsoft and Carnegie Mellon University

    Cloud Computing Basics for Developers

    Find out about the basics of cloud computing and Microsoft Azure.

    You will learn:
    • the history of cloud computing
    • major cloud providers and types
    • what resources are available through the cloud
    • economic benefits of cloud computing
    • data centres
    • how to build apps using the cloud
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: 7 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Software developer
  • Microsoft

    Take your first steps with C#

    Find out about how to build simple applications using C#, a popular programming language.

    Learn how to:
    • write in C#
    • store and manipulate data
    • execute functions from code libraries
    • add logic to your code
    Certificate of completion: No
    Total study time: 4 hours
    Study type: Self-paced
    Cost: Free
    Related jobs: Software developer

This website, including use of any content uploaded or linked through it, is subject to a disclaimer. Please read this before using The Skills Toolkit.

data.DisplayText: Where to find free online learning
data.Author: admin

TitlePart.Title: Where to find free online learning

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Find more free online learning courses

  • Help with learning during Covid-19
  • English courses
  • Maths courses
  • Digital and IT courses
  • Business and finance courses
  • Health and social care courses
  • Personal development and lifestyle courses

Many organisations offer free online learning in a range of subjects and levels. You can explore providers, the subjects they offer and the levels available before choosing. For advice on what to look out for, see our guide to choosing an online course.

As well as online only providers, you might also find courses with:

  • state funded colleges and training organisations
  • universities - you can search UCAS to find these
  • large employers in a range of sectors like finance, IT, business and engineering

Courses offered by state funded universities and colleges are inspected and approved by the government. Private companies offering online learning are not, so you'll need to check to make sure that courses are of good quality.

The Open and Distance Learning Quality Council's guide may help you to find good quality online courses.

Help with learning during Covid-19

In the current Covid-19 crisis many providers are extending their online course provision. There are also commercial organisations offering some of their usually paid for courses for free. Make sure to check there is definitely no cost before signing up. Some providers to check are:

  • Accenture
  • Barclays Lifeskills
  • Barclays Digital Eagles
  • Linkedin Learning
  • Pearson (UK Learns)
  • Pluralsight - some free introductory digital skills courses available
  • Rolls Royce Digital Academy

English courses

Improve your written and spoken English skills.

  • The British Council
  • Pearson (UK Learns)

Maths courses

Improve your own maths or help your children to learn number skills.

  • National Numeracy Challenge
  • Khan Academy
  • Pearson (UK Learns)

Digital and IT courses

Get online as a beginner, learn how to use Word and PowerPoint, or develop advanced computer skills for things like data science and coding.

  • Accenture
  • Alison
  • Barclays Digital Eagles
  • Coursera
  • Future Learn
  • IBM
  • Google
  • iDEA
  • Khan Academy
  • Learning Curve Group
  • Rolls Royce Digital Academy
  • Talented Training
  • Vision2Learn
  • Pearson (UK Learns)

Business and finance courses

Skills to be more effective in a business environment. Learn management, business and financial practices, from leadership to bookkeeping or take a course in health and safety regulations.

  • Alison
  • Barclays Lifeskills
  • Coursera
  • Future Learn
  • Google
  • Learning Curve Group
  • Open Study College
  • Talented Training
  • unionlearn
  • Vision2Learn
  • Pearson (UK Learns)

Health and social care courses

Skills and knowledge to help you provide high quality, safe and compassionate care to vulnerable children and adults.

  • Alison
  • Future Learn
  • Learning Curve Group
  • Open Study College
  • Pearson (UK Learns)

Personal development and lifestyle courses

Develop an interest or hobby, improve your personal skills, or take care of your own mental wellbeing.

  • Alison
  • Barclays Lifeskills
  • Coursera
  • Google
  • Vision2Learn
  • Pearson (UK Learns)
